casebody.data:
NC BOARD OF PHARMACY
v.
COMMISSION. No. 673A05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 25, 2006. Carson Carmichael, III, M. Denise Stanford, Anna Baird Choi, Matthew W. Sawchak, Paul K. Sun, Jr., Julia F. Youngman, Stephen D. Feldman, Raleigh, for NC Board of Pharmacy. William W. Plyler, Stephen T. Smith, Raleigh, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Solicitor-General, for Rules of Review Commission, et al. Michael J. Tadych, C. Amanda Martin, Raleigh, Susan C. Winckler, Vice President, for American Pharmacists, et al. Ann M. Anderson, Research Triangle Park, Stanford D. Baird, Daniel J. Palmieri, Raleigh, for NC Citizens for Business, et al. Amy E. Pickle, for NC Coastal Federation, et al. Robert R. Marcus, Angela L. Little, Greensboro, Dale J. Atkinson, Julia C. Works, Evanston, IL, for NABP.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 21st day of July 2006 by NCRMA for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). By order of the Court in conference this the 25th day of July 2006."
